content: by jennifer pattison rebelicious on ravelry tilt is a sock with four different panels of colour meandering gently around the foot and ankle twist is a more aggressive version with the colours swirling around at twice the speed this is a sock recipe that assumes you already have a basic knowledge of sock knitting the pattern can be knit as written or you can add the colour pattern instructions the section in bold to your favourite plain toe-up sock pattern these instructions are for a toe-up sock but could easily be converted for toe-down construction as written the length of the foot is approx 9 and heel to top of cuff is approx 7 these were designed for the sock knitters anonymous december 2012 stashbuster challenge and as such are great for using up leftovers what you will need 5 different colours of fingering weight sock yarn weights given are overestimated to err on the side of caution your mileage may vary if basing the pattern on a different basic sock pattern colour a approx 25g for toes heels and cuffs colours b c d and e approx 16-18g each as written colours b and d will use slightly less than c and e 2mm double point needles circular methods may instead be used if desired or needles sized to get a gauge of 9-10 stitches and 12-13 row per inch stitch markers if desired instructions are written for 5 dpn examples shown in photos are elann essential 4ply red heart heart and sole regia galaxy online supersocke 100 candy colour and online supersocke 100 jungle colour toe with colour a cast on 28 stitches 2x14 using judy s magic cast-on http //knitty com/issuespring06/featmagiccaston html knit across the first 14 stitches this point will be the start of the round divide stitches evenly between 4 needles increase 4 stitches over each of the next two rounds and then every alternate round until there are 17 stitches on each needle finishing with a plain knit round example shown used knit into the front and back of stitch kfb increases for the first two rounds of increases then left and right leaning increases llinc and rlinc for all other increases on the second stitch from the start/end of the needle cut yarn leaving a tail to secure and weave in foot stitches are still evenly distributed across 4 needles needles 1 and 2 will be the underside of the foot and back of leg needles 3 and 4 will be front of foot and front of leg tilt & twist v4 by jennifer pattison page 1 of 3 for the tilt version work as written for the twist version only knit rounds 1 and 4 of each pattern omitting rounds 2 and 3 initial repeat of pattern round 1 join colour b and knit all stitches on needle 1 one quarter of the stitches drop colour b join colour c and knit all stitches on needle 2 second quarter of the stitches
